identificationModule.briefTitle: Comparison of Efficacy and Safety Among Dabigatran, Rivaroxaban, and Apixaban in Non-Valvular Atrial Fibrillation
identificationModule.officialTitle: Comparison of Efficacy and Safety Among DAbigatran, RIvaroxaban, and ApixabaN in Patients HavinG Non-Valvular Atrial Fibrillation in Taiwan (DARING-AF Study)

collaborators.name: National Cheng-Kung University Hospital Dou-Liou Branch
Ministry of Health and Welfare, Taiwan

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
1. The recent development of novel oral anticoagulants (NOACs), including direct thrombin inhibitor (dabigatran) and factor Xa inhibitors (rivaroxaban, apixaban, and edoxaban), could potentially overcome many drawbacks of warfarin, and might provide a safer, and even more effective and convenient alternative approach to warfarin in non-valvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF), especially in Asians.
2. According to the results of a meta-analysis comparing Asians and non-Asians, NOACs are preferentially indicated in Asians in terms of both efficacy and safety.
3. There is no randomized controlled trial with sufficient power to directly compare the efficacy and safety among NOACs in NVAF, not to speak of Asians and Chinese.
4. Indirect comparisons are only based on observation with a lot of limitations such as heterogeneous background characteristics, difference in study design, and diversity in time within therapeutic range in control group. The findings from indirect comparisons are not conclusive but only hypothesis-generating.
5. This investigator-initiated prospective randomized open blinded end-point clinical trial will directly compare the efficacy and safety among 3 NOACs in patients with NVAF in Taiwan. We hypothesize that rivaroxaban or apixaban is non-inferior to dabigatran in terms of the efficacy.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
1. participants

   a. eligible participants are randomly assigned to dabigatran, rivaroxaban, or apixaban with allocation ratio of 1:1:1
   * Patients are randomly assigned to receive dabigatran (110 or 150 mg twice daily), rivaroxaban (15 or 20 mg daily), or apixaban (5 mg twice daily) with dosage and frequency approved by the Ministry of Health and Welfare, Taiwan. Reduced doses (dabigatran 110 mg twice daily, rivaroxaban 10 or 15 mg daily, or apixaban 2.5 mg twice daily) are allowed in a subset of patients with one or more of the following criteria: an age of at least 80 years, a body weight of no more than 60 kg, a serum creatinine level ≥1.5 mg per deciliter (133 μmol per liter) or creatinine clearance around 30 to 49 ml per minute)
2. blood sampling, genotyping, and measurement of biomarkers

   a. bood samples (13 mL) from peripheral veins in all study subjects at baseline and 10 mL 3 months later, and stored for enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay as well as genotyping
3. outcome follow-up a. clinical follow-up is performed and clinical outcomes are obtained by clinic visit, telephone call or direct contact with participants or subjects' family quarterly after treatment for 2 times, then every 6 months

armGroups.label: Dabigatran
armGroups.description: oral dabigatran etexilate capsule 110 or 150 mg (110 mg in specific population) bid for entire study period

armGroups.label: Rivaroxaban
armGroups.description: oral rivaroxaban film-coated tablet 15 or 20 mg (10 or 15 mg in specific population) qd for entire study period

armGroups.label: Apixaban
armGroups.description: oral apixaban 5 mg (2.5 mg in specific population) bid for entire study period

interventions.name: Dabigatran etexilate
interventions.description: this drug is administered twice per day for the entire study period

interventions.name: Rivaroxaban
interventions.description: this drug is administered once per day for the entire study period

interventions.name: Apixaban
interventions.description: this drug is administered twice per day for the entire study period

primaryOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of the major embolic events
primaryOutcomes.description: a composite of stroke (ischemic or hemorrhagic), transient ischemic attack or systemic embolism

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of the major embolic events and death
secondaryOutcomes.description: a composite of all stroke (including hemorrhagic), systemic embolism, and death

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of the major embolic and vascular events
secondaryOutcomes.description: a composite of all stroke, systemic embolism, pulmonary embolism, acute myocardial infarction, and vascular death

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of all clinically relevant bleeding events
secondaryOutcomes.description: a composite of major bleeding or clinically relevant non-major bleeding events

otherOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of all stroke
otherOutcomes.description: stroke is defined as a focal loss of neurological function caused by an ischemic or hemorrhagic event with residual symptoms at least 24 hours after onset or leading to death

otherOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of systemic embolism
otherOutcomes.description: embolic events excluding stroke, pulmonary embolism or venous thromboembolism

otherOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of transient ischemic attack
otherOutcomes.description: a transient focal loss of neurological function caused by an ischemic event with complete recovery within 24 hours after onset

otherOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of death
otherOutcomes.description: all-cause death includes vascular and non-vascular causes

otherOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of pulmonary embolism
otherOutcomes.description: clinical diagnosis of pulmonary embolism should be confirmed by an image study

otherOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of acute myocardial infarction
otherOutcomes.description: acute myocardial infarction is defined in accordance with the universal definition proposed in 2012

otherOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of vascular death
otherOutcomes.description: sudden cardiac death, fatal stroke, fatal myocardial infarction, any other death for which there is no clearly documented non-vascular cause, and death from bleeding

otherOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of hospitalization for congestive heart failure
otherOutcomes.description: decompensated congestive heart failure requiring hospitalization for stabilization

otherOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of advanced chronic kidney disease
otherOutcomes.description: defined as estimated glomerular filtration rate \<30 mL/min/1.73m2 confirmed by 2 separate laboratory tests within 3 months

otherOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of cardiogenic shock
otherOutcomes.description: symptoms and signs of organ hypoperfusion (e.g. cool peripheries, oliguria) plus one of the following parameters: systolic blood pressure 90 mmHg or less, hypotension requiring inotropic/vasopressor therapy remaining after fluid challenge, heart rate of at least 60 bpm, or a cardiac index of 2.2 L/min/m2 or less

otherOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of any revascularization for peripheral artery disease
otherOutcomes.description: percutaneous transluminal angioplasty or bypass surgery for low extremity artery disease

otherOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of any revascularization for coronary artery disease
otherOutcomes.description: percutaneous coronary intervention or coronary artery bypass grafting for obstructive coronary artery disease

otherOutcomes.measure: Time to occurrence of any revascularization for carotid or vertebral artery stenosis
otherOutcomes.description: endovascular therapy, endarterectomy or bypass surgery for carotid or vertebral artery stenosis

otherOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of major bleeding events
otherOutcomes.description: defined as bleeding to cause a drop in hemoglobin level \>= 2g/dL, fatal bleeding, life-threatening bleeding, or symptomatic bleeding at critical sites (including intracranial, retroperitoneal, intraocular, or intrapericardial)

otherOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of life-threatening bleeding events
otherOutcomes.description: defined as fatal bleeding, symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage, bleeding to cause a drop in hemoglobin level \>=5g/dL, bleeding requiring transfusion with \>=4u blood component, bleeding requiring vasopressor administration, or bleeding needing surgery for hemostasis

otherOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of minor bleeding events
Time to the occurrence of clinically relevant non-major bleeding events
otherOutcomes.description: clinically overt bleeding that does not satisfy the criteria for major bleeding and that leads to hospital admission, physician-guided medical or surgical treatment, or a change in antithrombotic therapy

otherOutcomes.measure: Time to the occurrence of major or minor bleeding events

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria: Known AF (paroxysmal or persistent/ permanent) who are suitable and ready for NOAC treatment plus at least one of the following criteria

* Prior ischemic stroke, transient ischemic accident or systemic embolism
* Left ventricular ejection fraction ≤40% (documented by echocardiography or contrast ventriculography)
* Symptomatic congestive heart failure (≥ New York Heart Association Functional Class 2) within 6 months before screening
* Age ≥75 years
* Age ≥65 but \<75 years with diabetes mellitus, hypertension or coronary artery disease

Exclusion Criteria: Subjects are excluded if they have at least one of the following situations before screening:

* Known severe (i.e. hemodynamically significant) mitral stenosis regardless of having received operation
* Time elapsed from the onset of stroke ≤7 days
* Bleeding tendency
* Creatinine clearance rate ≤30 mL/min
* Known active liver disease (persistent elevation of alanine aminotransferase, aspartate transaminase or alkaline phosphatase ≥3 × upper normal limit; or advanced liver cirrhosis ≥Pugh B)
* Pregnancy
* Recent documented active malignancy or radiation therapy (≤6 months) and not expected to survive 3 years
* Unwilling to give informed consent
* Conditions other than AF that required anticoagulation
* Anemia (hemoglobin level \<90 g/L) or thrombocytopenia (platelet count \<100 × 109/L)
* Persistent uncontrolled hypertension (systolic blood pressure \>180 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure \>100 mmHg)
* Active infective endocarditis
* Patients considered unreliable by the investigator or have a life expectancy less than the expected duration of the trial because of concomitant disease, or has any condition which in the opinion of the investigator, would not allow safe participation in the study

locations.facility: Tainan Hospital Ministry of Health and Welfare
National Cheng Kung University Hospital Dou-Liou Branch
